content.p: Doctoral loan provided by the UK government A Postgraduate Doctoral Loan can help with course fees and living costs while you study a postgraduate doctoral course, such as a PhD. The government publish the most up to date loan amounts on their website. The amount you'll get is not based on you or your family's income. It will be paid directly to you. Whether you qualify depends on: Full eligibility criteria can be found on the GOV.UK website. Funding for postgraduate loans is different if you normally live in Wales. Students from the EU, EEA and Switzerland who are resident in the UK with 'settled' or 'pre-settled' status under the EU Settlement Scheme may qualify for a UK doctoral loan. Loans are not available for other international students. Applications are made online through Student Finance England. Find out how to apply through the GOV.UK website. Offered by UK government If you have any questions, contact Student Finance England.
